intro: Monogramma paradoxa var. angustissima, commonly known as the narrow-leaf monogramma, is a species of fern native to the forests of South America. It belongs to the family Polypodiaceae and is characterized by its delicate, lance-shaped fronds. The plant typically grows in shaded, moist environments, often on rocky or wooded slopes. Its leaves are usually bi-lobed and have a distinctive, intricate pattern of veins. This variety is noted for its ornamental value and is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens.
